div.p: A38 Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch) records, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Yesterday afternoon, dear Mr Macdonald, I had a call from Mr Lindt, who wishes credentials, and these I have written out, and if you and Colleagues of the Council near to you will approve of them, you perhaps will be so good to sign.
Lindt was about to depart for the New Hebrides; see J. Lindt to M, 3 June 1890 (in this edition as 90-06-03a). I wrote them out, so as to prevent delay, Mr L. leaving on Saturday. He further stated, that monetary help to him, should — according to wishes of some of our colleagues, — be left to you and myself. So perhaps you will kindly let me know your views on the subject.
See M to A. Macdonald, 5 June 1890, and M to A. Macdonald, 10 June 1890.

div.p: I like much to have a quiet talk with you for an hour on various subjects.
Capt Hatton Richards just writes that he will be this day and to morrow in Melbourne. I will bring him to you at your office.
